articles.author: Sky News
articles.title: Trump accused of 'pouring salt on the wounds' five years after murder that shook America
articles.description: Speaking to Sky News ahead of the five-year anniversary of George Floyd's death, Al Sharpton remembered the combination of "humiliation and deep anger" he felt seeing the footage of his death that swept the world during the COVID pandemic.
articles.content:
In the dozens of framed images and newspaper clippings covering the walls of his office in downtown New York City, Al Sharpton is pictured alongside presidents and leading protests.
He has spent decades campaigning and is perhaps the most famous civi... [3209 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump’s Policies Face Judicial Hurdles as Domestic Changes Stir Controversies
articles.description: A U.S. judge temporarily halted the Trump administration from revoking Harvard's international student enrollments, criticizing the move as unconstitutional. Simultaneously, Trump’s efforts to manufacture iPhones domestically and fast-track nuclear reactor approvals face logistical and legal challenges, while controversial policies prompt restructuring and legal battles.
articles.content:
A federal judge issued a temporary injunction against the Trump administration's attempt to retract Harvard University's ability to enroll international students, labeling the policy unconstitutional, a significant legal win for Harvard.
Meanwhile, P... [482 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Judicial Roadblock: Harvard's Enrollment Standoff in Trump's America
articles.description: A U.S. judge temporarily halted the Trump administration's move to revoke Harvard's ability to enroll foreign students, providing temporary relief to thousands of international students. The policy was seen as an overreach by the university and a violation of constitutional rights.
articles.content: A U.S. judge has temporarily prevented the Trump administration from revoking Harvard University's capacity to enroll foreign students. The contentious policy, deemed a violation of constitutional rights by Harvard, threatened to impact over 7,000 in... [613 chars]

articles.title: Trump signs executive orders intended to accelerate regulatory approvals for nuclear reactors
articles.description: The administration said Friday it wants to quadruple the U.S.’s installed nuclear capacity by 2050 to 400 gigawatts

articles.author: Firstpost
articles.title: Trump expands 25% tariffs on all smartphones made outside of US
articles.description: Initially, the president had announced that the duties would only apply to Apple after he called out CEO Tim Cook for sourcing its smartphones from India. It is unusual for a country's trade policy to target one company, however, Trump later expanded the tariffs to all smartphone makers

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Court Battle Over Pacific Monument Fishing Protections
articles.description: Environmentalists are contesting President Trump's order, which allows commercial fishing in the Pacific Islands Heritage Marine National Monument. They argue it removes vital protections, harming marine biodiversity. The lawsuit, supported by Earthjustice, highlights negative impacts on Native Hawaiian interests and the potential for ecological damage via longline fishing.
articles.content: Environmental advocates are taking legal action against President Donald Trump's executive order, claiming it removes essential protections from the Pacific Islands Heritage Marine National Monument. The order is said to pave the way for detrimental ... [790 chars]

articles.author: The Australian Financial Review
articles.title: Why didn’t Trump’s new tariff threat rock the market? TACO theory
articles.description: Investors largely shrugged off Donald Trump’s latest tariff pronouncements, but risks are building that shouldn’t be so easily ignored.
articles.content: When US President Donald Trump declared on Friday night he would slap the European Union with a 50 per cent tariff in less than 10 days, and hit Apple with a 25 per cent tariff if it didn’t start making iPhones in America, the market theorists went i... [310 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump Tariff Threats Roil Markets: iPhone Levies Loom
articles.description: President Trump has threatened new tariffs, including a 25% levy on imported iPhones, escalating a trade battle with the EU. This move has caused market instability and increased fears of economic downturn. Trump criticizes EU trade practices and targets Apple for not manufacturing in the U.S.
articles.content: U.S. President Donald Trump has reignited trade tensions by threatening a 25% tariff on imported iPhones, a move aimed at pressuring Apple to manufacture domestically. This announcement has caused a shake-up in global markets, reversing a period of d... [731 chars]

articles.title: As Trump focuses on his trade war, Brazil and China forge closer ties
articles.description: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has signed up to Xi Jinping’s vision of a multi-polar world, as Beijing expands its influence in Latin America
